intro: Ephemerantha paucilaciniata, commonly known as the slender leaved ephemerantha, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered in several states.
